      • split

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> split​(java.lang.String string,
                                                                         java.lang.String separator,
                                                                         java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.String> keyIdentifier)
        Splits a string key1value1, key2value2,... The keys are identified by the keyIdentifier. The tuples are separated by the given separator surrounded by zero or more whitespaces. The results are put into a hash map.
        Example: 
         
 </pre>"Ak = 5d , Absd < 7dsf ,  A > sdf" ->  {A=> sdf, Ak== 5d, Absd=< 7dsf}
 if the key identifier is (key->key.startsWith("A"))
        Parameters:
        string - the string to be split
        keyIdentifier - the predicate that identifies the substring which are actually keys
        Returns:
        a HashMap key-values.

        Type Parameters:

        T - the result type of the function
        Parameters:
        stream - the stream to be traversed.
        function - the function to be applied.
        Returns:
        the first non-null function application, or null if there is none.

      • parseString

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parseString​(java.lang.String text,
                                                                               char openpar,
                                                                               char closepar)
        splits a comma or blank separated string into its components. The components can be just strings without comma or blank, or they can be equations applicationName = value. The value can either be just a string or an arbitrary text enclosed in parentheses.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to be parsed
        openpar - the opening parenthesis
        closepar - the closing parenthesis
        Returns:
        a Map applicationName - value. If there was no value on the string, then the map contains the empty string as value for the applicationName.

      • parseHierarchy

        public static <T> void parseHierarchy​(java.lang.String hierarchy,
                                      java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String,T> storing,
                                      TriConsumer<T,java.lang.String,java.lang.String> inserter)
        This method parses a string intervalContaining hierarchy declarations. The string starts with a applicationName of the hierarchy. In the next lines there are declarations of the kind
        supernode : subnode1, subnode2, ....
        The subnodes can be distributed over several lines. Two declarations must be separated by a blank line.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the store into which the hierarchy is to be inserted.
        Parameters:
        hierarchy - the string with the hiuerarchy declarations
        storing - a function mapping the applicationName of the hierarchy to the corresponding store
        inserter - a consumer function: accept(store,supernode,subnode)

      • getClass

        public static java.lang.Class getClass​(java.lang.String prefix,
                                       java.lang.String name,
                                       java.lang.String postfix)
        tries to find a class with the given applicationName. The method hides the ClassNotFoundException.
        Parameters:
        prefix - usually a package prefix
        name - the main part of the class' applicationName
        postfix - optionally a trailer for the applicationName
        Returns:
        the class, or null if there is none with this applicationName.

        public static java.util.function.Function compileFunction​(java.lang.String imports,

      • compileFunction

        public static java.util.function.BiFunction compileFunction​(java.lang.String imports,
                                                            java.lang.String code,
                                                            java.lang.String argType1,
                                                            java.lang.String parameter1,
                                                            java.lang.String argType2,
                                                            java.lang.String parameter2,
                                                            java.lang.String resultType,
                                                            java.lang.StringBuilder errors,
                                                            int lineNumber)
        compiles a code-string into a two-place function
        Parameters:
        imports - optional import statements
        code - the code string, e.g. "i * i".
        argType1 - the first argument type, e.g. Integer
        parameter1 - the applicationName of the first argument.
        argType2 - the second argument type, e.g. Integer
        parameter2 - the applicationName of the second argument.
        resultType - the result type of the function application.
        Returns:
        the compiled function or null if an error occurred.

      • runServer

        public static java.lang.Thread runServer​(java.net.ServerSocket serverSocket,
                                         java.util.function.Consumer<java.net.Socket> serverProcess)
        runs a server at the given port.
        It opens a server socket at a given port and starts a new thread. The thread waits for connections. For each connection it starts another thread and applies the serverProcess to this socket.
        The loop can be stopped by closing the returned serverSocket.
        The method returns immediately whereas the thread runs indefinitely.
        Parameters:
        serverSocket - the serverSocket where the server waits
        serverProcess - the consumer function to be applied to the socket.
        Returns:
        the thread which serves the server

      • testSerialization

        public static java.lang.Object testSerialization​(java.lang.Object object)
                                          throws java.lang.Exception
        This method can be used to test the serilization of a class. It sends a serializable object through a socket and returns the deserialized version
        Parameters:
        object - the object to be serilized
        Returns:
        the deserialized copy
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if IO-Errors occur

      • isDisjoint

        public static <A,B> boolean isDisjoint​(java.util.ArrayList<A> list1,
                                       java.util.ArrayList<B> list2,
                                       java.util.function.BiPredicate<A,B> equal)
        checks whether the two lists are disjoint, given the equality tester. An empty list is disjoint with everything
        Type Parameters:
        A - the item type of the first list
        B - the item type of the second list
        Parameters:
        list1 - the first list
        list2 - the second list
        equal - the equality tester
        Returns:
        true if the lists are disjoint

      • isSubset

        public static boolean isSubset​(java.time.LocalDateTime start1,
                               java.time.LocalDateTime end1,
                               java.time.LocalDateTime start2,
                               java.time.LocalDateTime end2)
        checks if the interval [start1,end1[ is a subset of [start2,end2[
        Parameters:
        start1 - the start time of the first interval
        end1 - the end time of the first interval
        start2 - the start time of the second interval
        end2 - the end time of the second interval
        Returns:
        true if the interval [start1,end1[ is a subset of [start2,end2[

      • disjointWith

        public static boolean disjointWith​(java.time.LocalDateTime start1,
                                   java.time.LocalDateTime end1,
                                   java.time.LocalDateTime start2,
                                   java.time.LocalDateTime end2)
        checks if the two intervals are disjoint.
        Parameters:
        start1 - start of the first half-open temporal interval
        end1 - end of the first half-open temporal interval
        start2 - start of the second half-open temporal interval
        end2 - end of the second half-open temporal interval
        Returns:
        true if the two intervals are disjoint

      • intersection

        public static java.time.LocalDateTime[] intersection​(java.time.LocalDateTime start1,
                                                     java.time.LocalDateTime end1,
                                                     java.time.LocalDateTime start2,
                                                     java.time.LocalDateTime end2)
        computes the intersection of two half-open intervals
        Parameters:
        start1 - start of the first half-open temporal interval
        end1 - end of the first half-open temporal interval
        start2 - start of the second half-open temporal interval
        end2 - end of the second half-open temporal interval
        Returns:
        [start,end] of the intersection, or null if the intervals do not intersect.

        B - the item type of the second list
        Parameters:
        list1 - the first list
        list2 - the second list
        equal - the equality tester
        Returns:
        true if the lists are disjoint

      • intersection

        public static <T> java.util.stream.Stream<T> intersection​(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.stream.Stream<T>> streams)
        returns a stream which delivers the intersection of the contents of the streams The resulting stream must be closed explicitly. If the first stream is infinite, the resulting stream will also be infinite. There should be at least one finite stream among the second - last streams, otherwise the intersection test might not terminate.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the streams' items
        Parameters:
        streams - a list of streams
        Returns:
        a stream for delivering the intersection of the streams' items.

      • streamConcat

        public static <N,M> java.util.stream.Stream<M> streamConcat​(java.util.Collection<N> collection,
                                                            java.util.function.Function<N,java.util.stream.Stream<M>> streamGenerator)
        conctenates for all items in the collection the non-null streams generated by the streamGenerator
        Type Parameters:
        N - the item type in the collection
        M - the item type in the stream
        Parameters:
        collection - any collection of items
        streamGenerator - maps items to streams (or null)
        Returns:
        the concatenated stream, or null

      • streamConcat

        public static <N> java.util.stream.Stream<N> streamConcat​(java.util.stream.Stream<N> stream1,
                                                          java.util.stream.Stream<N> stream2)
        concatenates two streams. They both can be null
        Type Parameters:
        N - the type of the stream's items
        Parameters:
        stream1 - a stream or null
        stream2 - a stream or null
        Returns:
        the concatenated stream, or null.

        public static int getWeek​(java.time.LocalDateTime time)
        This method computes the calendar week number for a given time point. Week 0 means actually the last week of the previous year.
        Parameters:
        time - a time instant
        Returns:
        the week number of this time

      • splitEquations

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> splitEquations​(java.lang.String code,
                                                                                  char separator,
                                                                                  char openpar,
                                                                                  char closepar,
                                                                                  java.lang.StringBuilder errors)
        This method recursively splits a string with equations 'variable = term, variable = term,...' into the individual assignments The terms may be enclosed by parentheses containing further equations: These are split recursively
        Parameters:
        code - a string with equations 'variable = term, variable = term,...'
        separator - a character which separates the equations.
        openpar - an opening parentheses in the terms.
        closepar - an closing parentheses in the terms.
        errors - for inserting error messages
        Returns:
        a HashMap with variable -> term,... or null, if there were errors. The Hash-values are either Strings or HashMaps again.

      • main1

        public static void main1​(java.lang.String[] args)

      • findCharacter

        public static int findCharacter​(java.lang.String string,
                                char character,
                                char openpar,
                                char closepar,
                                int start)
        The method searches the first occurrence of the character, while skipping substrings enclosed in openpar, closepar. Example: "a = (b = c, d = (e = k, f = h)), e = f, h= g". The first occurrence of ',' is at position 31
        Parameters:
        string - the string to be checked.
        character - the character to be searched
        openpar - the opening parenthesis, e.g. (
        closepar - the closing parenthesis, e.g. )
        start - the start position of the search
        Returns:
        the position of the character, or -1 if it is not found.

        the first method with this name, or null.

      • normalizedByMonth

        public static java.time.LocalDateTime normalizedByMonth​(int year,
                                                        int month,
                                                        int day,
                                                        int hour,
                                                        int minute,
                                                        int second,
                                                        java.lang.StringBuilder errors,
                                                        java.lang.String source)
        This method normalizes a date, given by year, month, day, hour, minute, second and turns it into a LocalDateTime. The date parameters may be arbitrary positive of negative integers.
        Parameters:
        year - a year
        month - a month
        day - a day of the month
        hour - an hour
        minute - a minute
        second - a second
        Returns:
        the normalized LocalDateTime

      • normalizedByMonth

      • getLines

        public static java.util.stream.Stream<java.lang.String> getLines​(java.io.InputStream stream,
                                                                 java.lang.String comment,
                                                                 java.lang.String commentStart,
                                                                 java.lang.String commentEnd,
                                                                 char concat,
                                                                 boolean trim)
        This method turns an InputStream into a Stream<String%gt where optionally comments are removed and lines are concatenated.
        Parameters:
        stream - the input stream
        comment - a comment string like '//' which means that all character after this string in the line are removed as comments.
        commentStart - a comment string like '[[', together with ']]' which means that all characters between these strings are removed as comments.
        commentEnd - the end characters for comments.
        concat - a character like '\' which, placed at a line's end means the current line and the next line are to be concatenated.
        trim - if true then leading and trailing spaces in lines are removed. Empty lines are removed as well.
        Returns:
        a Stream which yields the sequence of reduced lines.

      • parseKeyValueLines

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parseKeyValueLines​(java.util.stream.Stream<java.lang.String> stream,
                                                                                      java.lang.String separator,
                                                                                      java.lang.StringBuilder errors)
        This method parses a Stream<String> with lines consisting of 'key separator value' entries into a HashMap.
        Parameters:
        stream - the stream of lines to be parsed
        separator - a separator, e.g. '='
        errors - for inserting error messages
        Returns:
        the parsed key-value maps as a HashMap.

      • parseRelationLines

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object[]> parseRelationLines​(java.util.stream.Stream<java.lang.String> stream,
                                                                         java.lang.String separator,
                                                                         java.lang.StringBuilder errors)
        This method parses a Stream<String> with lines consisting of 'left relation right', where 'left' and 'right' are 'separator' separated strings without blanks. Example: line: 'IFI, IFM, IST in Institute, LMU' is parsed as [in,[IFI,IFM,IST],[Institute,LMU]] where the second and third components are ArrayList<String>.
        Parameters:
        stream - the stream of lines to be parsed
        separator - a separator, e.g. ','
        errors - for inserting error messages
        Returns:
        the parsed lines as ArrayList: [relation, left, right]

        the temp directory

                                         java.lang.String content)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the string to the temporary file with the given name and filename extension. The method should basically be used for test purposes.

        extension - the filename extension
        content - the string to be written on the file
        Returns:
        the new File
        Throws:
